title: Going against the grain: How farmers in Asia, Australia are beating the heat with new crop varieties
title_page: Going against the grain: How farmers in Asia, Australia are beating the heat with new crop varieties | The Straits Times
maintext:
NEW DELHI - Crops have always been at the mercy of the weather. But climate change is making farming even more of a lottery, with increasingly extreme weather damaging crops, cutting yields and slashing farmersâ€™ incomes.
And increasingly hot and dry weather is especially harmful, affecting the ability of crops such as wheat to grow.
